section.title: What is Network Error Logging?
section.description: Network Error Logging (NEL) is a tool built into browsers that helps detect and report network errors.
section.details: NEL is used to automatically report failures to a server. It can track issues like DNS errors, failed connections, slow responses, or server overloads.

section.title: Why is it important?
section.description: NEL helps site owners identify network problems experienced by users.
section.details: By collecting reports from client-side errors, developers can improve performance and reliability. NEL helps proactively detect recurring issues.

section.title: How is it used?
section.description: NEL is implemented using HTTP response headers and reporting APIs.
section.details: To enable NEL, developers use headers like `Report-To` and `NEL`, which configure the browser to send error logs to a specified endpoint.
